alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Grayson; Hancock; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 9:06AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Perry, Hancock, northwestern Grayson, Breckinridge and northeastern Ohio Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 804 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Santa Claus, moving south southeast at 45 mph. These storms will be moving in over the 90 minutes. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will be moving into and bring a burst of heavy rain, lightning and hail. Warnings are possible for hail if they maintain their intensity. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Perry, northwestern Grayson, Hancock, northeastern Ohio and Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Ranger, Mcquady, Skillman, Goering, Ralph, Se Ree, Shreve, Gerald, Buras and Tar Fork. TIME...MOT...LOC 1304Z 290DEG 176KT 3810 8696 MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
